en.title: Math Multiplication
en.lesson_1_intro_1: Before we begin our mission, let's first learn about some tricks with multiplication!
en.lesson_1_mult2_1: In multiples of two, the trick is to simply add the number by itself.
en.lesson_1_mult2_2: For example, 2x6 can be looked at as 6+6, which equals to 12.
en.lesson_1_mult2_3: That's all there is to it when multiplying with 2.
en.lesson_1_commutative_1: The commutative property of multiplication means that you can multiply two numbers in any order.
en.lesson_1_commutative_3: With this trick, you only need to memorize half the multiplication table!
en.lesson_1_tutorial_1: Now banish these blobs by connecting them in the correct order.
en.lesson_1_tutorial_end_1: Excellent! You are now ready for the mission!
